description:
Urashima, an island far from the mainland. The people who live there lead carefree lives. But five years ago, the island's three great families suffered a series of misfortunes, and succumbed to suspicion. The people of the island cut off all contact with the mainland, and began a slow decline. The key to saving the island lies in three girls who belong to the three families. But they are bound by old traditions, and are conflicted. On that island, a lone man washes ashore. The man claims to be from the future, and he begins a solitary struggle to change the island's fate.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Coastal
tags.description: Story prominently takes place near the beach or around a coastal area/town. Setting is near the ocean.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Shrine Maiden
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a shrine maiden.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

node.description: Front Wing is a Japanese visual novel studio that products that specializes in the production of adult visual novels. To date, the company has released 22 different games, came with three popular well-English released games/anime of Makai Tenshi Jibril, Majo no Ochakai and Canary.

He is a drummer for the Japanese rock band THE LINDA!, which was formed in 2002 when its members were enrolled at Rikkyo University.

__[Website](http://asaka1007.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/asakaofficial)__

__Birthplace:__ Aichi Prefecture, Japan
__Hobbies & Special Skills:__ Watching Anime, Karaoke, Cosplay, Sleeping, English

__Asaka__ is a Japanese vocalist and translator.

__Birthplace:__ Osaka Prefecture, Japan

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sakai_Sampo) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%A0%BA%E4%B8%89%E4%BF%9D)

Mitsuyasu Sakai is a Japanese critic, translator and science fiction writer.

Sakai graduated from Mikunigaoka High School, and he holds a Master's degree in Electronic Engineering from Kansai University. After working at NTT as an A.I. researcher, he became a sci-fi novel writer and translator. He also started handling scripts and sci-fi related work on anime. In 2018, he crowdfunded the production of a live-action film and managed to fund 19 million yen, which is the highest film production crowdfunding ever achieved in Japan. In 2021, he produced, directed and wrote a short film, title "Orbital Christmas." A novelization of the work was written by [Haruna Ikezawa](https://anilist.co/staff/95439/).

He holds a regular event on Live Wire called "Haruna Ikezawa & Miho Sakai's SF Anything Box" with aforementioend voice actress and essayist Haruna Ikezawa.
Known to be a fast and efficient worker. Often directing multiple works at a time.

[Website](http://www.tamurayukari.com) | [Profile](http://amuleto.jp/talents/tamura_yukari.html) | [Music Profile](http://www.kingrecords.co.jp/cs/artist/artist.aspx?artist=15412) | [Twitter](http://twitter.com/yukari_tamura) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yukari_Tamura) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%94%B0%E6%9D%91%E3%82%86%E3%81%8B%E3%82%8A) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@OfficialChannel-eu5sl)

She is a popular Japanese singer-songwriter and voice actress (seiyuu), currently affiliated with Amuleto (as seiyuu) and with King Records (as songstress). Affectionately called Yukarin by her fans, she is also known for her soft voice and interest in Lolita fashion. She made her debut as a voice actress in 1997, releasing her debut single Yuuki wo Kudasai on March 26, 1997.
While also a well-known seiyuu, several of her releases have been used as opening and ending themes for anime series, while some have reached the Oricon top 100 singles and album charts. Her role as Takamachi Nanoha in the Magical Girl Lyrical Nanoha series contributed to a rise in her popularity, as several of her singles (Little Wish: Lyrical Step, Spiritual Garden, Hoshizora no Spica, Beautiful Amulet) were used as the ending themes for the franchise's anime adaptations.

Non-Anime Roles
- Nahida (Genshin Impact) [VG]
- Qiqi (Genshin Impact) [VG]
- Theresa Apocalypse (Honkai Impact 3rd) [VG]
- Vita Clotilde - The Legend of Heroes Series [VG]
- Yvette - Strinova [VG]
Matsui Gorou is a lyricist. He was born in Gifu Prefecture and resides in Tokyo.

Haggy Rock is a Japanese arranger, composer and lyricist affiliated with Dream Monster. He has worked with various artists such as [Inori Minase](https://anilist.co/staff/106297/Inori-Minase), [Shiina Natsukawa](https://anilist.co/staff/118818/Shiina-Natsukawa), [Asaka](https://anilist.co/staff/120412/Asaka), [Yui Ogura](https://anilist.co/staff/105981/Yui-Ogura) and [Konomi Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/110607/Konomi-Suzuki).
